required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High-flow Nasal Oxygen During Rigid Bronchoscopy Under General Anesthesia: a Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: High-flow Nasal Oxygen During Rigid Bronchoscopy Under General Anesthesia: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of high-flow nasal cannula oxygen administration on apnea in patients undergoing general anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy compared with standard anesthesia methods.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A prospective Randomized, open label Trial

primary_outcome.time_frame: apnea period during the rigidbroscopic procedure/surgery
primary_outcome.description: the lowest value of oxygen saturation measured percutaneously at extremity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: intraoperative (The time taken to reach the point at which peripheral oxygen saturation fell below 90 for the first time immediately after the onset of apnea)
Intraoperative (end-tidal CO2 partial pressure after 3 consecutive breaths after intubation or insertion of laryngeal mask following end of apnea)

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial oxygen / carbon dioxide partial pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: shortly before start of apnea (within 30 seconds)

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial oxygen / carbon dioxide partial pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: shortly after end of apnea (within 30 seconds)

arm_group.description: 100 % of oxygen at 70 L / min through Optiflow ™ (Fisher and Paykel Healthcare Limited, Auckland, New Zealand)

intervention.description: supply of 100 % of oxygen at 70 L / min through Optiflow ™ (Fisher and Paykel Healthcare Limited, Auckland, New Zealand) plus standard oxygen supply through rigid bronchoscope during apnea period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Patients undergoing general anesthesia with stent placement or bougination, biopsy or removal of a foreign body or a mass through a rigid bronchoscope
- 2. Patients aged 19 or older who meet American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical class 2-4
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Patients with dementia or cognitive impairment
- 2. pregnant women
- 3. Patients undergoing extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO)
- 4. Patients with active nasal bleeding), severe nasal obstruction, recent nasal trauma of surgery
- 5. Patients with current maxillofacial trauma or basal skull fracture
- 6. Patients who had previously undergone rigid bronchoscopy / surgery
- 7. If the subject includes a person who can not read the written consent (eg, illiterate, foreigner, etc.)

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine , Anesthesia and Pain Research Institute, Yonsei University College of Medicine
